com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations

Annotation Type ServoType


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ServoType
    ServoType is an annotation with which a class or interface can be decorated in order to define a new kind of servo that can be configured in the robot configuration user interface.

    If the servo is not connected to a REV Hub, only the flavor parameter will be applied, as other servo controllers do not support setting a custom PWM range.

    If the flavor is STANDARD or CONTINUOUS, this annotation can be placed on any class or interface.

    If the flavor is CUSTOM, this annotation MUST implement HardwareDevice and have a constructor with at least one of the following constructor signatures:

    1. ctor(ServoControllerEx controller, int port) -- Only used when configured on a REV Hub
    2. ctor(ServoController controller, int port) -- Only used when configured on a CDIM

    Must be accompanied by DeviceProperties annotation

    See Also:
    HardwareMap.put(String, HardwareDevice), HardwareMap.get(Class, String), HardwareMap.get(String)

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      ServoFlavor flavor
      Indicates whether the servo is a standard servo, a continuous rotation servo, or if you're defining an entirely new type of servo device

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      double usPulseFrameRate
      Specifies the rate, in microseconds, at which the PWM is transmitted
      double usPulseLower
      Specifies the minimum PWM rate used, in microseconds.
      double usPulseUpper
      Specifies the maximum PWM rate used, in microseconds.

    • Element Detail

      • flavor

        public abstract ServoFlavor flavor
        Indicates whether the servo is a standard servo, a continuous rotation servo, or if you're defining an entirely new type of servo device

      • usPulseLower

        public abstract double usPulseLower
        Specifies the minimum PWM rate used, in microseconds. This corresponds to a servo position of 0.0.
        Default:
        600.0

      • usPulseUpper

        public abstract double usPulseUpper
        Specifies the maximum PWM rate used, in microseconds. This corresponds to a servo position of 1.0.
        Default:
        2400.0

      • usPulseFrameRate

        public abstract double usPulseFrameRate
        Specifies the rate, in microseconds, at which the PWM is transmitted
        Default:
        20000.0
